paragraphs.content: Chapter 29
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 29

paragraphs.content: Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,

paragraphs.content: Oh that I were as in months past, as in the days when God preserved me;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Oh that I were as in months past, as in the days when God preserved me;

paragraphs.content: When his candle shined upon my head, and when by his light I walked through darkness;
paragraphs.contentHtml: When his candle shined upon my head, and when by his light I walked through darkness;

paragraphs.content: As I was in the days of my youth, when the secret of God was upon my tabernacle;
paragraphs.contentHtml: As I was in the days of my youth, when the secret of God was upon my tabernacle;

paragraphs.content: When the Almighty was yet with me, when my children were about me;
paragraphs.contentHtml: When the Almighty was yet with me, when my children were about me;

paragraphs.content: When I washed my steps with butter, and the rock poured me out rivers of oil;
paragraphs.contentHtml: When I washed my steps with butter, and the rock poured me out rivers of oil;

paragraphs.content: When I went out to the gate through the city, when I prepared my seat in the street!
paragraphs.contentHtml: When I went out to the gate through the city, when I prepared my seat in the street!

paragraphs.content: The young men saw me, and hid themselves: and the aged arose, and stood up.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The young men saw me, and hid themselves: and the aged arose, and stood up.

paragraphs.content: The princes refrained talking, and laid their hand on their mouth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The princes refrained talking, and laid their hand on their mouth.

paragraphs.content: The nobles held their peace, and their tongue cleaved to the roof of their mouth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The nobles held their peace, and their tongue cleaved to the roof of their mouth.

paragraphs.content: When the ear heard me, then it blessed me; and when the eye saw me, it gave witness to me:
paragraphs.contentHtml: When the ear heard me, then it blessed me; and when the eye saw me, it gave witness to me:

paragraphs.content: Because I delivered the poor that cried, and the fatherless, and him that had none to help him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Because I delivered the poor that cried, and the fatherless, and him that had none to help him.

paragraphs.content: The blessing of him that was ready to perish came upon me: and I caused the widow’s heart to sing for joy.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The blessing of him that was ready to perish came upon me: and I caused the widow’s heart to sing for joy.

paragraphs.content: I put on righteousness, and it clothed me: my judgment was as a robe and a diadem.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I put on righteousness, and it clothed me: my judgment was as a robe and a diadem.

paragraphs.content: I was eyes to the blind, and feet was I to the lame.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I was eyes to the blind, and feet was I to the lame.

paragraphs.content: I was a father to the poor: and the cause which I knew not I searched out.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I was a father to the poor: and the cause which I knew not I searched out.

paragraphs.content: And I brake the jaws of the wicked, and plucked the spoil out of his teeth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And I brake the jaws of the wicked, and plucked the spoil out of his teeth.

paragraphs.content: Then I said, I shall die in my nest, and I shall multiply my days as the sand.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then I said, I shall die in my nest, and I shall multiply my days as the sand.

paragraphs.content: My root was spread out by the waters, and the dew lay all night upon my branch.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My root was spread out by the waters, and the dew lay all night upon my branch.

paragraphs.content: My glory was fresh in me, and my bow was renewed in my hand.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My glory was fresh in me, and my bow was renewed in my hand.

paragraphs.content: Unto me men gave ear, and waited, and kept silence at my counsel.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Unto me men gave ear, and waited, and kept silence at my counsel.

paragraphs.content: After my words they spake not again; and my speech dropped upon them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: After my words they spake not again; and my speech dropped upon them.

paragraphs.content: And they waited for me as for the rain; and they opened their mouth wide as for the latter rain.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And they waited for me as for the rain; and they opened their mouth wide as for the latter rain.

paragraphs.content: If I laughed on them, they believed it not; and the light of my countenance they cast not down.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If I laughed on them, they believed it not; and the light of my countenance they cast not down.

paragraphs.content: I chose out their way, and sat chief, and dwelt as a king in the army, as one that comforteth the mourners.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I chose out their way, and sat chief, and dwelt as a king in the army, as one that comforteth the mourners.
